They say some Elvaan girl was attacked while in the Temple of the Goddess--right in front of the statue of Altana!
What is this city coming to!?${prompt}
Huh? You think it was a Tenshodo member that did the dirty deed!?
${name-player}, you'd better watch your tongue unless you want to see it on a plate!${prompt}
That blue-haired girl was taken to Monberaux's after the attack. I'm pretty sure she'll be all right, though. Doctor M. is the best medic in town.${prompt}
You don't need to worry, ${name-player}. Our city's fine doctor is taking care of Prishe as we speak.${prompt}
And as for the fiends that would do something like this, I guarantee you my men and women will find them.${prompt}
If you're looking for Prishe, she and that rich boy Tenzen have already set sail for the Tavnazian Archipelago. You're following them, right?${prompt}
Sir, the airships are ready for departure.${prompt}
I will be traveling on a separate vessel. If “he” appears before I arrive, prevent him from escaping, but do not attack.${prompt}
Yes, sir!${prompt}
It is all working as planned. Now, I will finally retrieve what is mine.${prompt}
Hey there, pal.
I just met the weirdest Elvaan kid.${prompt}
She didn't have a single gil on her, but she spent hours in the gem store mooning over the same piece of jewelry.${prompt}
Eventually, the beauties working behind the counter got tired of her antics and threw her out.${prompt}
I'd been watching the whole thing and had the rotten luck of meeting the girl's eyes when she left the store.${prompt}
She's been dogging me ever since.${prompt}
I don't know if it was female intuition or what, but somehow she figured out I have a thing for the three ladies in the gem store.${prompt}
So, which one's my favorite out of the three?${prompt}
At first I thought the classical beauty on the left was my type.${prompt}
But then I got to thinking older women are the way to go, like the lady on the right.${prompt}
And then, not long ago, the pure and innocent type in the middle actually said hello to me.
Now I'm captivated by her charms.${prompt}
To be perfectly honest with you, any of those three ladies could make me a happy man.${prompt}
My plan is to confess my feelings to the one who likes me the most--the one least likely to turn me down.${prompt}
When I explained all this to the Elvaan girl, she almost split her sides in laughter.
The little brat!${prompt}
She told me that if I talked to each of the ladies in turn while holding ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}, I would know which of them had feelings for me.${prompt}
But I've never even heard of ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}, let alone seen one.${prompt}
Even an adventurer like you wouldn't have a clue where to get a gem like that, would you?${prompt}
Any clue about ${item-plural: 1[2]}?
${selection-lines}
I have a pretty good idea.
Never heard of them.${prompt}
No clue, right?
I think that kid's just stringing me along for a laugh.${prompt}
You serious?
Are you sure you're not just making fun of my feelings, like that Elvaan kid?${prompt}
Grrr!
Just thinking about the smirk on that brat's face...${prompt}
Could I really find out which of those beauties had feelings for me if I had ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}?${prompt}
Nah, things are never that easy.
That Elvaan brat is just making fun of me.${prompt}
Is that really...${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}!?${prompt}
I can't believe that kid was telling the truth.
Well, I'll be damned.${prompt}
There's no time to lose.
I gotta get in there and find the girl of my dreams!${prompt}
You ready?
I'm going in!${prompt}
I'm looking to buy a necklace...${prompt}
Of course, sir!
Is it a gift for someone special?${prompt}
Um, yeah...could be...${prompt}
We have a great selection for you to choose from! Just a moment, sir!${prompt}
Man, my hands won't stop sweating.${prompt}
So how's this ${item-singular: 1[2]} supposed to work?${prompt}
Whoa!
The ${item-singular: 1[2]} changed color!
Is this what she meant!?${prompt}
This ${item-singular: 1[2]} is one fantastic gem!${prompt}
You wandered off before things got interesting, but you shoulda seen the sparks of romance fly between me and Adelflete.${prompt}
My mind is made up!${prompt}
It's more than just knowing that she likes me.
Now I realize just how much I liked her!${prompt}
You say you've seen it all before?${prompt}
Hahaha!
Looks like someone has a small case of jealousy.${prompt}
Well, here's a little present from the happiest man in the world to help cheer you up.${prompt}
Hahaha!
Don't look so glum. The world's full of possibilities, even for you!${prompt}
Hahaha!
I'm sorry, but one look at your face tells the whole story.
Seeing me with my new girl reminds you of how unlucky you are, right?${prompt}
Don't worry, pal! The world's full of possibilities!
Hahaha!${prompt}
The customer Adelflete just served--isn't he the man who's always loitering outside the store?${prompt}
Did you happen to see the gem he was holding?
It's a rare stone that changes color depending on the temperature.${prompt}
Ah yes, I've seen one before.
When the person holding it becomes hot and flustered, the hue of the gem changes.${prompt}
I've heard that it's used in other countries to measure the intensity of a person's feelings.${prompt}
Which would mean that he's quite taken by our Adelflete, wouldn't it?${prompt}
I was wondering who he was after for quite a while now.
Now we know.${prompt}
I can't wait to see what happens.
It's just like having one of those romantic plays right inside the store!${prompt}
What, you want to explore the towers of Pso'Xja?
That shouldn't be a problem. We recently opened those ruins to all explorers.${prompt}
However, the Tenshodo is currently conducting an investigation on the deeper areas of the central tower, and we can't have pesky adventurers running around getting in our way.${prompt}
Though...if you were to scratch our backs, we wouldn't have any problems scratching yours.${prompt}
It just happens that the Tenshodo is searching for a certain jewel that is very popular in the Near Eastern countries.${prompt}
What kind of gem is it? Hmmm... Well, they're thin, hexagonally shaped, and come in rare colors like carmine and cyan. I heard that rich people like to decorate their turbans with them.${prompt}
They even say that sometimes a strange light shoots from their centers, though I've never seen it happen.${prompt}
Luckily for you, we've been finding a lot of those jewels in the other towers of Pso'Xja.${prompt}
Unfortunately, some strange device in that place seems to weaken even the strongest of our members. That's where you come in.${prompt}
Now, if you were to find one of those and bring it back to me, I'm pretty sure I could convince the boss to allow you access to the central tower.${prompt}
If you want to have access to the deeper parts of Pso'Xja, bring me a jewel from the ruins and I'll see what I can do.${prompt}
Hmmm...
This looks a lot like what we're dealing in, but the color just isn't right. We want something a little more “exotic” than the regular colored gems.${prompt}
Well, what do you know?
This is exactly what we've been looking for.${prompt}
You know, you're not a bad treasure hunter. Did you ever think of joining the Tenshodo?${prompt}
Ah, but you'd probably get bored really quick.
Anyway, take this pass. It will give you access to the more “sensitive” areas of the ruins.${prompt}
But I'll warn you one last time--the central tower ruins are still under investigation.${prompt}
Don't expect any search parties if you happen to get lost.${prompt}
Welcome to Neptune's Spire!
Hm? Oh, I remember you. You're the one that brought us that gem from Pso'Xja.

The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:${prompt}
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of “Flammen-Brenner.”${prompt}
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with “Flamme,” or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.${prompt}
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.${prompt}
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.${prompt}
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.${prompt}
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The “match score” section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.${prompt}
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.${prompt}
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.${prompt}
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.${prompt}

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed ${number: 0} members, or if there are fewer than ${number: 1} members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.${prompt}
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The ${color: 5}Master of Ceremonies${color: 1} (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.${prompt}
“LS Liga” is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.${prompt}
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.${prompt}

The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.${prompt}
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.${prompt}
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.${prompt}
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.${prompt}
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.${prompt}

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.${prompt}
Like Ballista, ${color: 5}quarry${color: 1} (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} and temporary items.${prompt}
However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can ${color: 5}trade${color: 1} a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.${prompt}
${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the ${color: 5}scout${color: 1} ability cannot be used in Brenner.${prompt}
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.${prompt}
The ${color: 5}sprint${color: 1} (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.${prompt}
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.${prompt}
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.${prompt}
I'm sorry. I wasn't listening. Could you start over from the beginning?${prompt}

${name-player}, do you still remember Palometa's story?${prompt}
Once there was a meeting of two great masses.${prompt}
One, an entity of “dark.”${prompt}
One, an entity of “light.”${prompt}
Their collision gave birth to a violent storm.${prompt}
The storm rose towards the heavens, and burst into a million fragments.${prompt}
One shard of the storm glittered in the sky.
One shard of the storm shone below the earth.${prompt}
And thus we pray.
To hold both shards within our hands...${prompt}
I interpret this to be a story about the greatness of chance meetings.${prompt}
There are chance meetings the value of which is comparable to the rarest of treasures.
I think you'll agree.${prompt}
It was through the Glass of All-Seeing's power, not mere chance, that we were able to meet, you and I.${prompt}
Without the mirror's guidance, I daresay our paths may never have crossed.${prompt}
However, this in no way detracts from the importance I place in our friendship.${prompt}
I am grateful the mirror led us together, ${name-player}.${prompt}
I thought you should know that.${prompt}
I look forward to your company for many more adventures to come...${prompt}
You feel the bonds between you and your adventuring fellow strengthen!${prompt}
${color-alt: 15}${name-player}'s badge flashes brightly.${prompt}
Airships are prohibited from flying in the skies above the Aht Urhgan Empire.
If you want to visit the Near East, by sea is the only way to go!${prompt}
Port Al Zahbi must be packed with all the people coming and going by ship, like Jeuno and Tavnazia used to be!${prompt}
Well, let me take a look at this Near Eastern cookbook I just got.
It says “soup” is called “corbasi,” and the secret to a delicious dish is...${prompt}
Why, the secret is to simmer it in a ${keyitem-singular: 7[2]}, of course!${prompt}
Jeuno is different from the other nations.
I actually kind of enjoy watching everyone squabble with each other.${prompt}
I can't imagine why anyone would want to go all the way to the Near East and become a mercenary.${prompt}
I heard that the Near East is bursting at the seams with wonderful treasures never seen this side of Vana'diel.${prompt}
I can't figure out which sounds more interesting--the Tenshodo or the Near East...${prompt}
You have shiny badge.${prompt}
I don't have shiny badge.
Very, very sad.${prompt}
Verena sensed that Lion was alive somewhere.${prompt}
I really wanted to believe her, but deep down I was convinced that we'd never see Lion again.${prompt}
You're one of a kind...${prompt}
Adventurers are more than simple sellswords looking to fight the next new monster in the next new land to bring home the newest treasure.${prompt}
You fulfill the dreams that others have given up on.
That's what makes a true adventurer.${prompt}
Fighting with the ancients.
Battling the Emptiness.${prompt}
For someone who stands at the peak of their adventuring career, I may be bringing up old news.${prompt}
But we will never forget. And there are others, too, who had given up on their dreams--they will remember you.${prompt}
So you should go to Norg. Go and see Lion.${prompt}
So you should go.${prompt}
There's someone waiting for you, am I right?${prompt}
You don't talk much, and I won't ask you about what happened beneath the light of that great, burning crystal.${prompt}
I'm just happy to have Lion back among us.
If you head to Norg, you might even be able to see her.${prompt}
I'm just happy to have Lion back among us.${prompt}
The boss sure is cheerful these days.
He was putting on a show before so we wouldn't worry, but I've known him too long to fall for that.${prompt}
He won't say anything about what happened. But that spark is back in his eye, and that's enough for me! Things are about to get interesting!${prompt}
Are you telling me that Lion's back?
Where the hell has she been? She's lucky I don't give her what for.${prompt}
Lion...
She really had us worried!${prompt}
What's going on?
The boss is walking around like he's seen the Gates of Paradise, or something.${prompt}
He always gets like that when you're around.
I don't get it, you don't look that special to me.
Phrase en Français: Il est toujours comme ça quand tu es là.

Phrase en Anglais: It's starting to give me the heebie-jeebies...${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je ne comprends pas, tu n'as pas l'air si spécial pour moi.

Phrase en Anglais: Being part of the Tenshodo means you'll sell your soul for the right amount of gil.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Ça commence à me donner la chair de poule...${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Besides, taking risks is good for business, I always say.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Faire partie des Tenshodo signifie que tu vendrais ton âme pour la bonne somme de gil.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: This time, we 'ave got quite a special customer, so we can't go prattling off about the details of their request to just anyone.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: De plus, prendre des risques est bon pour les affaires, je dis toujours.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Getting wind of such a thing could make our client a mite angry, and we certainly wouldn't want that.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Cette fois, nous avons un client très spécial, alors nous ne pouvons pas révéler les détails de sa demande à n'importe qui.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: That's why I 'ave been mixing up the orders with random bits o' information and givin' out mere snippets at a time. Those o' you with sense should be able to put it all together, is what I think.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Si cela venait à se savoir, notre client pourrait se mettre en colère, et nous ne voudrions certainement pas cela.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I dare say I think you may fit into tha' category, as well.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: C'est pourquoi j'ai mélangé les commandes avec des informations aléatoires et donné de simples bribes à la fois. Ceux qui ont du sens devraient pouvoir tout assembler, à mon avis.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Anyway, that's how things are standing at the moment.
Phrase en Français: Je dirais que tu pourrais aussi appartenir à cette catégorie.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Well, what need you? Speak up now.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Quoi qu'il en soit, c'est ainsi que les choses se présentent pour le moment.

Phrase en Anglais: Ask about what?
Phrase en Français: Eh bien, que veux-tu ? Parle maintenant.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: ${selection-lines}
Phrase en Français: Demander à propos de quoi ?

Phrase en Anglais: Goods for sale.
Nothing.
Phrase en Français: Marchandises à vendre.

Phrase en Anglais: ${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Rien.

Phrase en Anglais: Looks like I was wrong about you.
Anyway, if you want to buy goods, hop on over to Ghebi Damomohe at the entrance or jus' talk to the two at the counter.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: On dirait que je me suis trompé à ton sujet.

Phrase en Anglais: That's all I have t' say to you. Now get out o' here and let me do my business in peace.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Quoi qu'il en soit, si tu veux acheter des marchandises, va voir Ghebi Damomohe à l'entrée ou parle juste aux deux au comptoir.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: If you do not need anything, wha' in blazes are you doing hangin' about here in the first place?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: C'est tout ce que j'ai à te dire. Maintenant, sors d'ici et laisse-moi faire mes affaires en paix.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Why, I must say you're even brighter than you look.
Phrase en Français: Si tu n'as besoin de rien, que fais-tu donc ici à traîner dans les parages ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You got 'ere the same way, didn't you?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Eh bien, je dois dire que tu es encore plus intelligent que tu n'en as l'air.

Phrase en Anglais: Lately, people 'ave been strewing about ${item-plural: 0[2]} like there's no tomorrow, so a lot o' Tenshodo members don't know that trick.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Tu es arrivé ici de la même manière, n'est-ce pas ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: O' course, me and the boss are on a whole different plane o' thinking.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Dernièrement, les gens ont éparpillé des ${item-plural: 0[2]} comme s’il n’y avait pas de lendemain, donc beaucoup de membres du Tenshodo ne connaissent pas ce tour.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Still, the notion of “seeing the unseen” was one o' the main draws of the Tenshodo for me in the beginning. I've got high hopes for you...${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Bien sûr, moi et le patron sommes sur un tout autre plan de réflexion.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Eh?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Pourtant, la notion de « voir l'invisible » était l'une des principales attractions du Tenshodo pour moi au début. J'ai de grands espoirs pour toi...${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Ah, sorry. I left out the most important part, didn't I? Sorry t' leave you hanging there.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Hein ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Um... What was I saying, again?
Phrase en Français: Ah, désolé. J'ai laissé de côté la partie la plus importante, n’est-ce pas ? Désolé de te laisser en suspens.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Oh, yeah...the Empire of Aht Urhgan. You want t' see the Near East, don't you? I can see it in your eyes.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Euh... Qu'est-ce que je disais, déjà ?

Phrase en Anglais: How does Aht Urhgan sound to you?
Phrase en Français: Oh, oui... l'Empire d'Aht Urhgan. Tu veux voir le Proche-Orient, n'est-ce pas ? Je le vois dans tes yeux.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: ${selection-lines}
Phrase en Français: Que penses-tu d'Aht Urhgan ?

Phrase en Anglais: I want to go!
Psh, not interested.
Phrase en Français: Je veux y aller !

Phrase en Anglais: ${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Bof, pas intéressé.

Phrase en Anglais: Heheh, I appreciate your honesty.${prompt}
Is 'at so? That's all I 'ave to say to you then, so get out o' here.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Heheh, j'apprécie ton honnêteté.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Well, aren't you clever? But once is enough. Seriously.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Est-ce que c'est ça ? C'est tout ce que j'ai à te dire alors, sors d'ici.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Anyway, that's enough batting aroun' the bush for now. Let's dig straight in t' the juicy details, shall we?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Eh bien, n'es-tu pas intelligent ? Mais une fois, c'est suffisant. Sérieusement.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You know the ships at Mhaura used t' transport prospective mercenaries to the Near East? If you want t' climb aboard one o' those vessels, you 'ave got to go through none other than the Tenshodo here.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Quoi qu'il en soit, assez tourné autour du pot pour l'instant. Passons directement aux détails croustillants, d'accord ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: We received a request from the Empire 'erself. Getting those ships t' port was a royal pain. We finally managed t' bargain a cheap price on some rickety old vessels, and...${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Tu sais que les navires à Mhaura transportaient autrefois des mercenaires potentiels vers le Proche-Orient ? Si tu veux monter à bord de l'un de ces navires, tu dois passer par le Tenshodo ici.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: And you don't care. Sorry abou' that. A man's got to vent sometimes.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Nous avons reçu une demande de l'Empire elle-même. Faire accoster ces navires était un véritable casse-tête. Nous avons finalement réussi à négocier un prix avantageux sur quelques vieux navires délabrés, et...${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Anyway, you should know by now how things work around 'ere. If you want something, you 'ave to bring me something I want, first.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Et tu t'en fiches. Désolé pour ça. Un homme doit parfois se défouler.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: If you aren't in the mood t' scavenge up what I want, you can always cough up gil instead. O' course, that would be quickest.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Quoi qu'il en soit, tu devrais savoir maintenant comment les choses fonctionnent ici. Si tu veux quelque chose, tu dois d'abord m'apporter quelque chose que je veux.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Let's make this explanation brief, shall we?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Si tu n'as pas envie de chercher ce que je veux, tu peux toujours donner des gils à la place. Bien sûr, ce serait plus rapide.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You see, prices are a mite different in the Near East. Something that sells for a gil a dozen here might be a luxury item in Aht Urhgan.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Rendons cette explication brève, d'accord ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Jumping straigh' to the point, now.
Phrase en Français: Tu vois, les prix sont un peu différents au Proche-Orient. Quelque chose qui se vend une gil la douzaine ici pourrait être un article de luxe à Aht Urhgan.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I want you t' bring me some common items from this side o' Vana'diel, and I'll give you the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} in exchange.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Passons directement au but, maintenant.

Phrase en Anglais: The more you bring me, the better. I 'ave put together a few lists if you'd like to take a look. I will leave it t' you which to bring me.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je veux que tu m'apportes des articles courants de ce côté de Vana'diel, et je te donnerai ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} en échange.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Ah yes, and there is gil, too. Righto.
Phrase en Français: Plus tu m'apportes, mieux c'est. J'ai préparé quelques listes si tu veux y jeter un œil. Je te laisse choisir quoi m'apporter.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You can buy your way out if you choose.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Ah oui, et il y a aussi les gils, bien sûr.

Phrase en Anglais: If you decide t' go the gil route, I will need ${number: 0} gil up front. That's nothing for adventurers nowadays, righ'? You can also consider it your price o' failure, heheh.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Tu peux acheter ton passage si tu choisis cette option.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: So what'll it be?
Phrase en Français: Si tu choisis la route des gils, j’aurai besoin de ${number: 0} gils à l’avance. Ce n’est rien pour les aventuriers de nos jours, n’est-ce pas ? Tu peux aussi considérer cela comme le prix de ton échec, heheh.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I'll read the list now, so decide which set is in your budget and make a note o' what you need.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Alors, qu'est-ce que ce sera ?

Phrase en Anglais: What'll it be?
Phrase en Français: Je vais lire la liste maintenant, décide quel ensemble est dans ton budget et prends note de ce dont tu as besoin.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: It's going t' take you some work if you want to go to Aht Urhgan, but you cannot get there through anyone but us.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Laisse-moi réfléchir.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Heh heh heh...${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Ça va te demander du travail si tu veux aller à Aht Urhgan, mais tu ne peux pas y aller autrement que par nous.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: The advanced list, eh? A superb choice. The items on this list are few, so they should fit nicely in your bag, but they are quite difficult t' come by.
You can choose from the following:${prompt}
Phrase en Français: La liste avancée, hein ? Un choix superbe. Les articles sur cette liste sont peu nombreux, donc ils devraient bien tenir dans ton sac, mais ils sont assez difficiles à trouver.

Phrase en Anglais: One coffer key from a beastman stronghold--Davoi, Beadeaux, Castle Oztroja, the Temple of Uggalepih, the Den of Rancor, the Quicksand Caves, or the Sea Serpent Grotto.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Tu peux choisir parmi les suivants:${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: A “testimony.” Those ancient scraps of papyrus seem t' be quite popular with collectors these days. I don't know all the details, but apparently there's a testimony for any o' the jobs an adventurer can be. Anyway, I just need one.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Une clé de coffre provenant d'un bastion des hommes-bêtes--Davoi, Beadeaux, Château Oztroja, le Temple d'Uggalepih, la Tanière du Rancor, les Cavernes de Sable, ou la Grotte du Serpent de Mer.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Your last option is t' bring me chips from Pso'Xja.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Un “témoignage”. Ces vieux morceaux de papyrus semblent être très populaires auprès des collectionneurs ces jours-ci. Je ne connais pas tous les détails, mais apparemment, il existe un témoignage pour chacun des métiers d'un aventurier. Quoi qu'il en soit, j'ai juste besoin d'un seul.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: That's it for the advanced list.

Phrase en Anglais: You can bring me any one o' the above requests, but if you decide t' bring Pso'Xja chips, I'll need 'em in a set o' three.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Intermediate, eh?

Phrase en Français: Intermédiaire, hein ?

Phrase en Anglais: But anyway, the situation 'as driven up the demand for beastman spoils.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Mais quoi qu'il en soit, la situation a fait monter la demande pour les dépouilles des hommes-bêtes.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Je veux que tu m’apportes ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}, et ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]}.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: It may sound simple, but those items are scattered all about the strongholds and are rather difficult t' get a hold of.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: C'est tout pour la liste intermédiaire.

Phrase en Anglais: You say you want t' go to Aht Urhgan, but you're too big o' a coward to face a challenge, eh? That attitude will get you nowhere in the Empire, I tell you. Ah well, it's all the same t' me, as long as I make a profit.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: This will be more like running errands, but there are a lot o' things for you to collect on this list.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Tu dis vouloir aller à Aht Urhgan, mais tu es trop lâche pour affronter un défi, hein ? Cette attitude ne te mènera nulle part dans l'Empire, je te le dis. Ah bien, c'est tout pareil pour moi, tant que je fais du profit.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: There are a lot o' curious items here. I need you to bring me ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}, ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}, and ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]}.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: ...Oh, et une dernière chose--${article} ${item-article: 5[2]}. Apporte-moi ces six objets en une fois, et je serai satisfait.${prompt}

Phrase en Français: Allons-y.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Can you hear me, anyway...?

Phrase en Anglais: Well, when you open your eyes, you're in for a surprise. Heheh.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: O' course, we found a way around that, and dropped you into that ginormous forest from the sky. The Tenshodo'll always give you your money's worth.${prompt}

1. “The Heart of Venture Roll.”
2. “Rules of the Roll.”
3. “Putting the Book Down.”${prompt}

Venture roll is a competitive game played with dice similar to those used by corsairs. The objective is to roll until your cumulative total comes as close to 11 as possible without going over.${prompt}

Until you reach or go over 11, you may continue rolling (${color: 5}doubling up${color: 1}) as many times as the table time limit allows (${number: 8} ${choice-plurality: 8}[minute/minutes], Earth time).${prompt}
In addition to doubling up, you may also decline to roll the dice and stay with your current total (${color: 5}hold fast${color: 1}).${prompt}

If your total ever goes over 11, you will automatically lose the game, regardless of the totals of other players. Knowing the right time to hold fast is one of the keys to staying in the match.${prompt}

Once all the players have held fast, the game is over and the results are announced. The player closest to 11 is declared the winner and receives all the gil in the pot (the original participation fees of all the players).${prompt}
Objective: Roll a six-sided die as many times as necessary to achieve a total as close to 11 as possible. You lose the instant your total exceeds 11.${prompt}
If two or more players are the closest to 11 at the end of a match, the game is considered a ${color: 5}draw${color: 1} and all participation fees are repaid in full.${prompt}
Once the game has started, fees will not be refunded for any reason unless the match results in a draw.${prompt}

Moblin Maze Mongers is the revolutionary new business venture that's taking Vana'diel by storm!
Making ingenious use of previously neglected caverns beneath Mindartia and Quon, our expert staff will create the perfect dungeon for you and your fellow adventurers!${prompt}
Use one of our state-of-the-art “Maze Tabulae” to lay out the guidelines, and sit back as our craftsmen dig and delve to your demanding specifications!${prompt}
Your maze will also be populated with a plethora of foul fiends and all manner of devious devices, all of which can also be customized to your liking!${prompt}
The maze you design may be a relaxed jaunt for the novice adventurer, or it may be a diabolical demesne that will challenge even the most battle-hardened adventurers.
With control over almost every aspect of your creation, the choice is yours!${prompt}
So what are you waiting for?
Let Moblin Maze Mongers build you the maze of your dreams--or nightmares--today!${prompt}
Moblin Maze Mongers makes designing your own dungeon quick and painless!
With three simple-to-use items--“Maze Tabulae,” “Maze Vouchers,” and “Maze Runes”--you'll be a mazebuilding master in no time.${prompt}

The first and most important of these items is the “Maze Tabula,” which stores the layout and content of your maze. By using other items in conjunction with the Maze Tabula, you can customize various elements of your dungeon.${prompt}
Next you have the “Maze Voucher,” a construction order that specifies the objectives that must be met to successfully complete your maze.${prompt}
After receiving your Maze Voucher, we will proceed to build a maze according to your specifications.
However, the Maze Voucher only dictates the final objectives for your dungeon--other details may be left to the whims of our craftsmen.${prompt}
You'd rather customize the nitty-gritty details yourself, you say? Fear not!
That's where “Maze Runes” come in.
The use of Maze Runes is completely optional, and is intended for detail-oriented adventurers who want more direct control over their creation.${prompt}
Be aware, however, that certain combinations of Maze Runes and Maze Vouchers are incompatible with each other, while others might produce unintended effects.
Still, the possibilities are nearly limitless, so clients are encouraged to experiment!${prompt}
You may notice that certain Maze Tabulae contain blackened squares, or squares containing elemental symbols.${prompt}
Black squares indicate squares that cannot hold Maze Runes.
Please manipulate your Maze Runes as necessary so that they do not touch any black squares.${prompt}
Elemental squares will enhance the effect of any Maze Runes they come in contact with.
Such Maze Runes will exert a far greater influence on your maze than under typical circumstances.${prompt}
The concept of elemental opposition does not apply to the Maze Tabula.
Provided that at least one compatible element exists, the Maze Rune in question will see its effect augmented.${prompt}
After customizing your dungeon with the three items described above, please trade your completed Maze Tabula to the Maze Monger Shopfront.${prompt}

Once your Maze Tabula is confirmed and you've paid the necessary excavation and construction fee, you and your companions will be escorted posthaste to your brand-spanking new, custom-built maze!${prompt}

Customers should know that due to high demand for the Maze Mongers' services, only one maze order can be accepted from any single adventurer per ${choice: 0}[twenty hours/one hour] (Earth time).${prompt}
However, there are no restrictions placed on using mazes created by other adventurers.
Adventurers who would like to take on multiple mazes a day are strongly encouraged to cooperate with their friends.${prompt}
This section will explain the procedure for adventuring in your custom-built maze from start to finish, entrance to exit!${prompt}
After your order has been accepted and paid for, you and your companions will be escorted to the maze lobby.
Please wait here patiently until the construction process is completed.${prompt}
During this time, our lead foreman Packapic will provide you with a brief overview of the facilities.
You will also be given the opportunity to purchase maze-specific items should you so desire.${prompt}
After construction has completed, our gatekeeper and guide Rediroq will lead you and your companions into the maze.
The challenge begins!${prompt}
Should you manage to successfully complete the conditions specified on the Maze Voucher, a treasure chest will appear somewhere within the maze.
What myriad riches may lie inside? You'll just have to see for yourself!${prompt}
After successfully retrieving your reward, you are free to exit the maze.
You may do so by any one of the following methods:${prompt}
”Leaving From the Exit”
Each maze will contain an exit door with a Maze Monger attendant posted in the vicinity.
If spoken to, this attendant will lead all participants out of the maze.${prompt}

Located near the exit is a beacon. Attendants have been instructed to trigger this as soon as the maze objectives have been successfully met, so you may use it as a guide in the event that you are unsure of your progress.${prompt}
“Using a ${item-singular: 0[2]}”
A complimentary ${item-singular: 0[2]} will be presented to you free of charge before you enter the maze.
Using this will cause the adventurer who used it--and that person alone--to be transported out of the maze.${prompt}
“Emergency Extraction”

Should unforeseen circumstances occur that are deemed to present an imminent danger to maze participants, Moblin Maze Mongers staff reserve the right to perform an emergency rescue operation to remove all participants from the maze.${prompt}
Now you have all the necessary knowledge to enjoy your custom maze!
Happy spelunking!${prompt}
Clients should be aware of the following rules and regulations governing the use of Maze Monger mazes.${prompt}
Adventurers who flee from a given maze without completing the stated objectives will not be permitted to re-enter that same maze.${prompt}
Upon completing the objectives, a treasure chest is guaranteed to appear somewhere within the maze.
Please do not forget to seek it out and claim your reward before exiting the dungeon.${prompt}
Maze difficulty will, in principle, be tailored to the highest level adventurer in the event that a party contains adventurers of disparate skill levels.
Note, however, that there may be exceptions to this depending on the objectives specified on your Maze Voucher.${prompt}
We at Moblin Maze Mongers strongly encourage building and exploring mazes in parties.
While we will not refuse solo clients, please be aware that completing the maze objectives alone may prove to be a difficult task.${prompt}
Our expert craftsmen take the highest pride in the safety and stability of their work.

Please understand, however, that due to the inherent tectonic instability of subterranean caverns, we cannot rule out the possibility of collapses or cave-ins occurring over the course of time.${prompt}
In such cases, we reserve the right to initiate emergency rescue operations that will instantly transport all clients outside the maze to safety.

Moblin Maze Mongers will accept no responsibility for treasures left unclaimed as a result of such a rescue operation, so adventurers are encouraged--for their own benefit--to proceed through the maze in a timely fashion.${prompt}
In addition to the treasures to be gained within mazes, adventurers will also receive special tokens called “Moblin Marbles” as a reward for the successful completion of a maze.${prompt}
These Moblin Marbles can be exchanged at the Maze Mongers office for a wide variety of exciting, exclusive goods and prizes!${prompt}
How about a nice, shiny one of these?${prompt}
Or a spiffy, sparkling one of these?${prompt}
Rack up enough Moblin Marbles, and there's a veritable cornucopia of prizes to be had!${prompt}
And that's not all--Moblin Marbles can also be used to purchase other benefits!
These include the ability to register your completed Maze Tabulae and share your creations with adventurers far and wide, or an assortment of official designations.${prompt}
Accumulate as many as you can and make the most of your maze-mongering experience!${prompt}
There's only one copy, so don't ye go carryin' it off now.

Come back when ye've seen more of the world, why don't ye?${prompt}
Thanks to the loyal patronage of adventurers like you, business is positively booming here at Moblin Maze Mongers!
We've been so successful, in fact, that unscrupulous rival corporations have sprung up trying to cash in on our profits!${prompt}
With great success, though, comes great responsibility!
Here at Moblin Maze Mongers, we are dedicated to preserving the pristine subterranean environment that makes our unique service possible.
Regrettably, this means there are times when we must temporarily close our mazes for necessary maintenance.${prompt}
At the same time, Moblin Maze Mongers always puts you, the customer, first!
How can we reward our loyal customers for their part in keeping our caves clean and tectonically sound?
Here's how: with our all-new Cave Conservation (C.C.) point system!${prompt}

Customers will receive their first C.C. point ${choice: 0}[thirty-two hours/one hour and twenty minutes] (Earth time) after exiting a maze they have created, with another point being added every ${choice: 0}[eight hours/twenty minutes] (Earth time) thereafter.
A maximum of six points may be accumulated at any one time.${prompt}
And what will C.C. points earn you? More loot, that's what!

Ordering a maze with C.C. points in your possession will result in the appearance of an additional, bonus treasure chest upon completion of your objectives! The contents will vary based upon your Maze Voucher, with greater riches awaiting you for each C.C. point you've accumulated.${prompt}
Please be aware that your C.C. points will be reset to zero upon ordering a new maze.
Any treasure that goes unclaimed will revert to the property of Moblin Maze Mongers. No returns, no refunds.${prompt}

Ah, ${name-player}. I've been waiting for you.${prompt}
My people have returned from their reconnaissance mission in Windurst. The situation is worse than we had feared.${prompt}
A representative from the Federation is due to arrive here any minute now for further talks.${prompt}
W-we have an emergency-ethy on our hands!
Now, before-ethy I proceed, please be reminded that not a single word spoken here today must be allowed to leave-ethy this room.${prompt}
If what my investigation has revealed is true-ethy, we have a major crisis looming.${prompt}
A teleportation mishap-ethy has resulted in the creation of a clone-ethy of Doctor Shantotto!${prompt}
Wh-what? As if one Doctor Shantotto wasn't already a handful, now we have to contend with two!?${prompt}
Of all the Goddess-forsaken incidents...${prompt}
And to rub-ethy salt into the wound, the evil tendencies exhibited by the newly created clone are such-ethy that they put the original doctor to shame-ethy!${prompt}
“Domina Shantotto,” she has taken-ethy to calling herself, though this you may already know-ethy.
Ever since her appearance-ethy, she hasn't wasted a second to enact her malicious machinations!${prompt}
Oh, my poor, tired head-ethy...${prompt}
If word-ethy gets out to the other nations, Windurst will become the laughingstock-ethy of the two continents!
But that's the least of our worries right now-ethy.${prompt}
Had only I heeded Principal Koru-Moru's warnings...
Oh, the Goddess strike-ethy me down for a fool!${prompt}

To avoid raising alarm bells, we've planted a life-size talking doll-ethy of the doctor at her abode and imbued it with a personality that's equally abrasive-ethy, but the people won't be fooled for long.${prompt}
We must act, and act fast-ethy, lest all of this becomes public knowledge and mass panic-ethy grips the land!${prompt}
Certainly not the kind of predicament you want to get dragged into should you wish to live to a ripe old age...
But as much as I'm loath to admit it, we--myself and all adventurers included--are already involved up to our necks.${prompt}
Whatever devious scheme that Domina Shantotto is plotting, it would be naive to assume that she has any less than the whole of Vana'diel in her sights.${prompt}
Now, I think it's safe to say that we're all agreed that action must be taken.${prompt}
But what should our first step be to avert this clear and present danger?${prompt}
Let me first tell-ethy you what else I know.${prompt}

Upon learning of the teleportation mishap-ethy, I sought to locate the whereabouts of the original-ethy Doctor Shantotto. I deduced that the clone-ethy might have had a hand in her disappearance.${prompt}
And sure-ethy enough, my sources have revealed that the original doctor is being held captive-ethy somewhere in Ro'Maeve.${prompt}
I propose-ethy that our first act is the rescue of “Original Shantotto”--for the sake of convenience, let's call-ethy her by this moniker for the time being.${prompt}
Ah, I see where you're going with this: fight fire with fire!${prompt}
It sounds like our best bet. The odds would be greatly improved if we had the original Shantotto fighting on our side.${prompt}
${name-player}, I trust I can rely on your full cooperation in this.${prompt}
Let's be on our way!${prompt}
I trust I can rely on your full cooperation in rescuing the original Doctor Shantotto.${prompt}
According to Professor Yoran-Oran, the doctor is being held captive in Ro'Maeve.${prompt}
“A perfect world order...${prompt}
...that exists solely for our pleasure”!?${prompt}
Does that witch's derangement know no bounds!?${prompt}
<Puff...wheeze...>
Th-the doctor's location-ethy! I have it!${prompt}
As a last resort, I employed the services of Windurst's infamous Cat Burglar-ethy, Nanaa Mihgo, to locate Doctor Shantotto.${prompt}
And true-ethy to her reputation, she's successfully tracked down the doctor's current hideout-ethy: the Sacrificial Chamber within the Temple of Uggalepih!${prompt}

The only hitch-ethy is--and acquiring this piece of information further lightened my coin purse-ethy--ancient artifacts known as “Tablets of Hexes” are required for entry. They can supposedly be found-ethy scattered throughout the temple and deeper within.${prompt}
Ah, yes. The Cat Burglar has never been one to lose scent of her prey.${prompt}
So the next leg of our journey takes us to Elshimo Island...${prompt}
By means fair or foul, we must put an end to Shantotto's nefarious plot.${prompt}
Vana'diel must not be allowed to fall into such tyrannical hands!${prompt}
But first, there are matters I must attend to in Jeuno.
I must ensure that the Tenshodo isn't left leaderless should...should the worst come to pass.${prompt}
One can't expect to lock horns with a fearsome adversary like the doctor and come out unscathed.${prompt}
Very well-ethy. Let us rendezvous at the Sacrificial Chamber.

The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.${prompt}
Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town.
If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.${prompt}
You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.
It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.${prompt}
Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.
The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.${prompt}
This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call “fewell.”
To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!${prompt}
As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require.
Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.${prompt}
With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing!

Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.${prompt}
The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!${prompt}
But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.${prompt}
If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.${prompt}
Take heart, though, as any materials inside your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will remain intact.
You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.${prompt}
Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.${prompt}
Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.${prompt}
Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions.
Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!${prompt}
You may be asking yourself, “Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?”${prompt}
Here's the good news: you don't have to!
For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.${prompt}
The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand.
At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.${prompt}
Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of ${item-singular: 0[2]}, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.${prompt}
Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that ${item-singular: 0[2]} may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.${prompt}
Mind you, ${item-singular: 0[2]} is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it.
Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.${prompt}
Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped.
May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!${prompt}
First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply.
You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.${prompt}
You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe.
Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.${prompt}
Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy.
If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.${prompt}
You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically.
Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.${prompt}
From here, it becomes a race against the clock!
Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.${prompt}
Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task.
First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.${prompt}
Next, you can begin to ${color: 5}feed fewell${color: 1} into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration.
Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.${prompt}
However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions.
Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.${prompt}

If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the ${color: 5}safety lever${color: 1} and ${color: 5}pressure handle${color: 1} to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.${prompt}
You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition.
Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.${prompt}
The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues.
You'll need to perform periodic ${color: 5}furnace repair${color: 1} should the furnace near its breaking point.${prompt}
It is also possible to ${color: 5}recycle strewn fewell${color: 1} during synergy.
While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.${prompt}
This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute.
As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.${prompt}
As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable.
There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.${prompt}
For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger.
Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!${prompt}
You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.${prompt}
In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well.
To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.${prompt}
Now let us return to the synergy process itself.
As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.${prompt}
If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance.
The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.${prompt}
Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills!
Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...${prompt}
What's an elemental surge, you ask?
Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.${prompt}

The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?${prompt}
...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell.
There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.${prompt}
Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe.
We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.${prompt}
Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients.
There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.${prompt}

Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.${prompt}
The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own.
The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.${prompt}

In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${item-singular: 0[2]} cannot be attached directly.
First, equipment must be prepared by etching an aperture into which an elementally compatible piece of ${item-singular: 0[2]} can then be embedded.${prompt}
The type of aperture that may be etched will depend on the piece of equipment.
There are also pieces of equipment that, alas, may not be modified at all.${prompt}
If you are curious what manner of aperture may be etched into a particular piece of equipment, you need only trade it to me or one of my colleagues.${prompt}
As a general rule, the higher the level of the item in question, the more difficult the synergy process for creating an aperture will be.${prompt}
You will find that certain pieces of equipment may be etched with multiple apertures.
It is, however, only possible to create one aperture at a time.${prompt}
Etching requires the use of a corrosive substance we call mordant.
Deposit mordant into a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and the process will begin.${prompt}
My colleagues and I have a stock of mordant available for sale.
The best way to learn is to practice, so if you're curious, we encourage you to purchase some and begin experimenting!${prompt}
The difficulty of the synergy process when embedding evolith is decided by a number of factors.${prompt}
Such factors include the variety of aperture and evolith, as well as the quantity of evolith you seek to attach.
Embedding the first piece is not too difficult a task, but the second and third pieces will not go in so easily.${prompt}
To begin the embedding process, deposit your evolith into the synergy furnace along with a piece of equipment with a compatible aperture.${prompt}
When etching or embedding, the required elemental balance may be confirmed at any time during the synergy process, so let this be your guide.${prompt}
Should you ever wish to remove any apertures and embedded evolith from a piece of equipment entirely, you may do so with an ingredient we call ${color: 5}revertant${color: 1}.${prompt}
Toss the revertant in a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and its potent powers will restore your item to a pure and pristine state!
Be warned, however, that embedded evolith will be lost forever in the process.${prompt}
As you are no doubt already aware, synergy makes use of a highly combustible form of elemental crystals that we call “fewell.”
The more complex the recipe, the greater the quantity of fewell required.${prompt}
Veteran synergists know well the hassle of having to constantly monitor their fewell supply and procure crystals to replenish depleted stock.${prompt}
To free you of such trifling burdens and allow you to focus your mind entirely on your art, we synergy engineers are offering a convenient fewell replenishment service!${prompt}
For a nominal fee calculated based upon the current state of your fewell reserves, we will instantly refill you to full capacity.${prompt}
That's right--all elements in one simple transaction, directly to your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
What could be easier?${prompt}
Looking to fire up your furnace and enter the world of ${item-singular: 0[2]}?
If so, you've come to the right place!${prompt}
We're proud to offer a supply of the corrosive agent known as ${color: 5}mordant${color: 1} for sale.

Mind you, our stock is limited to only the most diluted, readily produced form of the stuff.
You'll find that it only has the strength to etch items of relatively low level.${prompt}

Teach me!
Just give me ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
A life without intellectual curiosity is a life hardly worth living.
Should your eyes one day open to this truth, you are free to return.${prompt}
I thought you'd never ask!
Synergy is both an art and a science: an evolution--nay, a revolution--in synthesis.${prompt}

Using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} in conjunction with a synergy furnace--the apparatus you see beside me--the synergist wields the power of myriad elements to fabricate a veritable host of potent items.${prompt}

What we call ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} serves to dispense fewell crystals--the lifeblood of the synergy process--whilst also protecting its contents from the volatile reactions that occur within the bowels of the furnace.${prompt}
Synergy furnaces have been installed throughout the city for the use of all synergists.
The crucible is sufficiently compact and lightweight that you can carry it with you.${prompt}
Initiating the synergy process is as simple as inserting your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} into a furnace and commencing the infusion of elemental fewell.${prompt}
Needless to say, what will happen from there is not quite so simple.${prompt}
Successful synergy is contingent upon maintaining elemental equilibrium.
The prescribed ratio, of course, will vary depending on the artifact you are attempting to create.${prompt}
You can increase the ratio of a particular element by burning the corresponding variety of fewell.${prompt}
But herein lies the rub: synergy is a still young science, and the technology we employ remains, shall we say...unstable.${prompt}
A bit too much fewell here, a wrong lever pulled there, and the percolating pot will explode, spitting scalding elemental guck every which way to Firesday.${prompt}
That's why smart synergists synergize in numbers.
Too many culinarians might spoil the broth, but when it comes to synergy, it's the more the merrier!${prompt}
An aspiring synergist, I see!
If you're looking for ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, you've certainly come to the right place.${prompt}
I can sell you a splendid entry-level model for ${number: 0} gil.
A small price to pay to embark on a lifelong journey of scientific discovery, wouldn't you say?${prompt}
${number: 0} gil, paid in full!${prompt}
As promised, here's your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}.
And because I like your enthusiasm, I've even stocked it to the brim with fewell for you!
How's that for a deal?${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Synergy furnaces themselves may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Should you wish to learn more about the science of synergy, seek out one of the engineers stationed throughout the town.${prompt}
Welcome to the MHMU's porter service, kupo!
Which of your burdensome belongings shall I take off your hands today?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Bienvenue au service de porteur de l'MHMU, kupo !

Phrase en Anglais: Do something, kupo?
Phrase en Français: Quel fardeau de vos biens puis-je prendre en charge aujourd'hui ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: ${selection-lines}
Phrase en Français: Besoin d'aide, kupo ?

Phrase en Anglais: Porter service?
Buy a storage slip.
Phrase en Français: Service de porteur ?

Phrase en Anglais: No, thank you.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Acheter un bon pour le stockage.

Phrase en Anglais: Is your gobbiebag splitting at the seams? Mog Safe spilling over?
Phrase en Français: Non, merci.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Why, an accomplished adventurer like yourself surely has more stuff than you know what to do with.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Votre gobbiebag déborde-t-il de ses coutures ? Votre Mog Safe déborde-t-il ?

Phrase en Anglais: That's where I come in, kupo.
Phrase en Français: Eh bien, un aventurier accompli comme vous a sûrement plus de choses qu'il ne sait qu'en faire.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I'll gladly hold onto your prized possessions, freeing you space to gather up even grander goodies.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: C'est là que j'interviens, kupo.

Phrase en Anglais: To make use of my services, first you'll need to buy one of these storage slips for the low, low fee of 100,000 gil.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je me ferai un plaisir de garder vos biens précieux, vous laissant de l'espace pour rassembler encore de plus grands trésors.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Storage slips come in numerous varieties, kupo, each corresponding to a different type of item.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Pour profiter de mes services, vous devrez d’abord acheter l’un de ces bons pour le stockage pour le modique montant de ${number: 19} gils, kupo.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: You'll want to peruse the fine print closely, so you don't end up paying good gil for a scrap of parchment useless for the particular item you wish to store.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Les bons pour le stockage sont disponibles dans de nombreuses variétés, kupo, chacune correspondant à un type différent d'objet.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Not that we moogles would object to that sort of donation, kupo.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Vous voudrez examiner de près les petits caractères, afin de ne pas dépenser de bons gils pour un bout de parchemin inutile pour l'objet particulier que vous souhaitez stocker.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Choose the item you wish to entrust, then trade it to me along with a single storage slip.
Phrase en Français: Bien que nous, les moogles, ne nous opposions pas à ce genre de don, kupo.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I will take the item and return the slip to you, marked with an invisible seal.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Choisissez l'objet que vous souhaitez confier, puis échangez-le avec moi ainsi qu'un seul bon pour le stockage.

Phrase en Anglais: Invisible to you, at least.
Phrase en Français: Je prendrai l'objet et vous retournerai le bon, marqué d'un sceau invisible.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: It's plain as day to us moogles, so don't even think of trying to pull one over on us, kupo.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Invisible pour vous, du moins.

Phrase en Anglais: When it comes time to retrieve your item, just trade to me a single storage slip--any slip--once again.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: C'est clair comme de l'eau de roche pour nous, les moogles, alors ne pensez même pas à essayer de nous berner, kupo.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: I will present you with a list of all the items currently in my care, and you may choose the one you wish to withdraw.
Phrase en Français: Lorsqu'il sera temps de récupérer votre objet, échangez simplement avec moi un seul bon pour le stockage -- n'importe quel bon -- une fois de plus.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Simple as that, kupo!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je vous présenterai une liste de tous les objets actuellement sous ma garde, et vous pourrez choisir celui que vous souhaitez retirer.

Phrase en Anglais: What's more, no additional transaction fees will be incurred!
Phrase en Français: Aussi simple que cela, kupo !${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Pretty generous of us for a change, no?${prompt}
Phrase en Français: De plus, aucun frais de transaction supplémentaire ne sera engagé !

Phrase en Anglais: Now I bet you're wondering what the catch is, kupo.
Phrase en Français: Plutôt généreux de notre part pour une fois, non ?${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: So as not to disappoint you, there are a few!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Maintenant, je parie que vous vous demandez quel est le piège, kupo.

Phrase en Anglais: For one, any signed items will lose their signatures if you store them with me.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Pour ne pas vous décevoir, il y en a quelques-uns !${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: Why, you say? Hey, even we moogles aren't perfect!
Phrase en Français: Pour commencer, tous les objets signés perdront leurs signatures si vous les stockez avec moi.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: It's better for both of us if you keep your most precious possessions close at hand, kupo.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Pourquoi, dites-vous ? Hé, même nous, les moogles, ne sommes pas parfaits !

Phrase en Anglais: Now listen up, because there's another catch, and it's a doozy.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Il vaut mieux pour nous deux que vous gardiez vos possessions les plus précieuses à portée de main, kupo.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: If you lose your storage slip, I won't be able to return your item. Ever. No ifs, ands, or buts!
Phrase en Français: Maintenant, écoutez bien, car il y a un autre piège, et c'est un gros.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: No “I'm sorry, Mister Porter Moogle, it'll never happen again!”
Phrase en Français: Si vous perdez votre bon pour le stockage, je ne pourrai pas vous rendre votre objet. Jamais. Pas de si, de et de mais !

Phrase en Anglais: Rules are rules, kupo, and someone has to keep them.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Pas de "Je suis désolé, Monsieur Moogle Porteur, cela ne se reproduira jamais !"

Phrase en Anglais: Last, but not least, I can't accept equipment bearing Magian trial insignia.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Les règles sont les règles, kupo, et quelqu'un doit les respecter.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: If you have such an item that you're simply dying to entrust to me, you'll have to abandon your trial first, kupo.${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Enfin, mais non des moindres, je ne peux pas accepter d'équipement portant l'insigne d'essai de Magian.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: And that's all there is to it.
Phrase en Français: Si vous avez un tel objet que vous mourrez d'envie de me confier, vous devrez abandonner votre essai d'abord, kupo.${prompt}

Phrase en Anglais: This humble moogle can hardly wait to serve you!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Et c'est tout.
